resources.string: 天空中太阳行程 (日出到日落)
（触碰每个时间点获取更多的信息）
基于紫外强度水平的背景颜色
Image representing the app settings button
获取定位和新的紫外信息
Location is disabled. Turn it on then try again
There is no previous location data on the device. A precise location permission is required to update this, otherwise use a different app that has such permission (such as a maps app)
Location permission is required in order to get the UV information at your position
%1$s\n\nBackground location required for widget background updates. Go to location permissions in app settings and select the %2$s option
An unexpected error occurred, please try again
UV data update had an error
Pull down to start a new request
During the solar noon, the sun is at its highest position in the daytime sky, resulting in the maximum UV exposure.
During the nadir, the sun is at its lowest position below the earth, making it the darkest moment in the night.
Sunrise marks the moment when the top edge of sun is just visible on the horizon.
Sunset marks the moment when the bottom edge of the sun begins to go below the horizon. At this point, the sun is slightly lower than Sunset Start time.
The sunrise officially ends once the bottom edge of the sun touches the horizon, as the sun is going up.
Sunset technically starts the moment that the bottom edge of the sun touches the horizon, as it is going down.
Dawn is the time from which the appearance of indirect sunlight can be observed.
Dusk is the time when the sunset is ending just before night, with only indirect sunlight still visible.

Nautical Dawn refers to the original definition observation of dawn by sailors. Whereas astronomical dawn occurs when the sun is 18 degrees below the horizon in the morning, nautical dawn is defined as the sun being 12 degrees below the horizon.

Nautical Dusk refers to the original definition observation of dusk by sailors. Whereas astronomical dusk occurs when the sun is 18 degrees below the horizon in the evening, nautical dusk is defined as the sun being 12 degrees below the horizon.
This is the time when night officially ends, just before the dawn appears.
The is the official time when the night starts and dusk has completely ended.
This is the time when the morning golden hour ends. Between dawn and this time is the best time for photography.
This is the time when the evening golden hour starts. After this time is the best for photography.
